page.title: 08SMITH'S GREEN FARM part 2
page.content: ....to be made into sugar. Most of the straw gets burnt but some is given away and some is kept. There is one regular man who works on the farm with Mr Graves. Propogation for future crops is done mainly using seed produced in previous years but sometimes new seed is bought in to strengthen the crop. Altogether he has got{700 {chickens}that lay approximately{200 {eggs every day.}All the eggs are sold to private customers. They have got one egg sorting machine which sorts the eggs into sizes. None of the eggs are fertilized and therefore do not hatch, as it is more economical to buy in chicks when they are required.
